install.title: Install MeerCOP
install.subtitle: Install the laptop anti-theft app
install.launchFromHome: Launch MeerCOP from your home screen.
install.iosStep1: Tap the Share button at the bottom of Safari
install.iosStep2: Scroll down and tap "Add to Home Screen"
install.iosStep3: Tap "Add" in the top right corner
install.browserInstall: Select "Install App" or "Add to Home Screen" from the browser menu.

sections.appIntroContent: MeerCOP is a real-time monitoring app to prevent laptop theft and unauthorized use. When monitoring is enabled from your smartphone, any motion, touch, or lid opening detected on the laptop triggers an immediate alarm with photos, location, and live streaming.
sections.createAccountDesc: Sign up with email and password, then complete email verification. You can log in after verification.
sections.installLaptopDesc: Open the MeerCOP site on your laptop browser ‚Üí enter the serial number to register the device. The registered laptop automatically goes online and syncs with your smartphone.
sections.installPhoneDesc: Open the site on your smartphone browser and install via "Add to Home Screen". Android shows an install popup automatically. On iOS, use Safari's share button ‚Üí "Add to Home Screen".
sections.deviceSelectionBarDesc: Select the laptop to monitor from the top bar. Tap to switch between multiple devices.
sections.statusIconsDesc: Tap the location (üìç), camera (üì∑), network (üåê), or settings (‚öôÔ∏è) icons to access each feature.
sections.monitoringToggleDesc: Use the "MeerCOP ON/OFF" button at the bottom to start or stop monitoring.
sections.camouflageModeDesc: Tap the monitor icon next to the toggle to make the laptop screen appear off. Monitoring continues.
sections.monitoringOnDesc: Monitoring activates the laptop's accelerometer, camera, keyboard/mouse detection. Anomalies trigger an immediate alert to your smartphone.
sections.motionDetectionDesc: When laptop is shaken or moved
sections.lidDetectionDesc: When closed laptop lid is opened
sections.cameraMotionDesc: When movement is detected in front of camera
sections.alertDesc: Both the smartphone and laptop sound alarms, and a full-screen alert mode is activated.
sections.alertLiveStreaming: üé• Live Streaming ‚Äî Real-time video from laptop camera (if connected)
sections.alertLaptopLocation: üìç Laptop Location ‚Äî View current location on map (if available)
sections.alertCapturedPhotos: üì∑ Captured Photos ‚Äî Auto-captured photos at the moment of detection
sections.alertUnavailable: If a feature is unavailable, it shows "Not detected" or "No info" while the alert screen layout is maintained.
sections.alertDismissPhone: üîï Dismiss Phone Alarm ‚Äî Stops only the smartphone alarm
sections.alertDismissComputer: üîá Dismiss Computer Alarm ‚Äî Remotely stops the laptop alarm (ends entire alert)
sections.cameraFeatureDesc: Tap the camera (üì∑) icon on the main screen to enter the camera view.
sections.cameraLiveStreaming: Live Streaming ‚Äî View real-time video from laptop camera
sections.cameraSnapshot: Snapshot ‚Äî Capture and save the current frame
sections.cameraSwitching: Camera Switch ‚Äî Switch front/rear camera (if supported)
sections.locationTrackingDesc: Tap the laptop (üìç) icon to view the laptop's current location on a map.
sections.networkInfoDesc: Tap the network (üåê) icon to view the laptop's network status, IP address, etc. A warning message appears on the main screen when the network is disconnected.
sections.settingNicknameDesc: Change the display name of the laptop.
sections.settingPinDesc: 4-digit PIN required to dismiss alarm on the laptop.
sections.settingSoundDesc: Choose from whistle, siren, bird sounds, etc., or upload a custom sound file.
sections.settingSensorDesc: Enable/disable sensors: lid, camera, keyboard, mouse, USB, power.
sections.settingSensitivityDesc: Adjust motion and mouse detection sensitivity (sensitive/normal/insensitive).
sections.settingSerialDesc: View registered serial numbers. Tap to copy.
sections.deviceManageDesc: Tap the device management button in the header to manage all registered devices.
sections.photoHistoryDesc: Tap "Photo Alert History" in the side menu to view past alert photos. Tap a photo for full screen view and save. Delete unnecessary records.
sections.camouflageDetailDesc: Camouflage mode makes the laptop screen appear off while monitoring continues. If someone approaches, the screen looks off, lowering their guard. All monitoring features work normally during camouflage.
sections.pushNotificationDesc: Push notifications are auto-subscribed when you select a device. You can receive alerts even when the app is in the background. Please allow browser notification permissions.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.q1: Does monitoring drain laptop battery significantly?
faq.a1: Sensor-based detection uses slightly more battery than normal, but very little when the screen is off. Disabling camera monitoring can further reduce battery consumption.
faq.a2: The laptop's local alarm works without internet. However, remote features like smartphone notifications, photo transfer, and live streaming require network connection. A warning appears on the main screen when disconnected.
faq.a3: Yes, register additional serial numbers to manage multiple laptops with one account. Switch between devices using the device selector at the top. Each device can be monitored independently.
faq.a4: You can change the alarm PIN in the smartphone app settings. Go to Settings ‚Üí Alarm PIN and enter a new 4-digit number. Or use the "Dismiss Computer Alarm" button on your smartphone to remotely dismiss.
faq.q5: What happens when the laptop enters sleep mode?
faq.a5: Sensors and network are disabled in sleep mode, so monitoring won't work. The smartphone shows "‚ö†Ô∏è Cannot connect to computer". We recommend configuring the laptop to not sleep when the lid is closed.
faq.q6: How do I change the alarm sound?
faq.a6: In Settings, tap "Alarm Sound" to choose from 6 built-in sounds or upload a custom audio file (under 5MB). Use the preview button (‚ñ∂) to listen before selecting.
faq.q7: It says camera is not detected.
faq.a7: This happens when the laptop has no webcam or browser camera permission is blocked. Change camera permission to "Allow" in the laptop browser's site settings (lock icon in address bar). For external webcams, check the USB connection.
faq.a8: Many laptops lack GPS, so IP-based location is used. IP-based location can differ from actual location by several kilometers. Wi-Fi-based location provides better accuracy when available.
faq.q9: Where do I get a serial number?
faq.a9: Serial numbers are provided at purchase or issued by an administrator. You can view registered serial numbers in the settings page and tap to copy to clipboard.
faq.q10: Can I adjust alert sensitivity while monitoring?
faq.a10: Yes, you can adjust motion sensitivity (sensitive/normal/insensitive) and mouse sensitivity separately in settings. "Sensitive" reacts to small vibrations, "insensitive" only detects large movements. "Insensitive" is recommended in vibration-prone environments like cafes.
faq.a11: Camouflage mode covers the laptop screen in black, making it appear off. But the browser continues all monitoring functions in the background. It can be used to make the laptop appear unused when leaving your seat at a cafe, encouraging and detecting theft attempts.
faq.q12: The app doesn't send push notifications.
faq.a12:
1. Check if browser notification permission is "Allow".
2. On iOS Safari, push notifications require PWA installation.
3. Reopening the app with a device selected auto-retries push subscription.
4. Notifications may be delayed in power saving or low power mode.
